ngiemboon: N nyé ńdíe lǐe, ńgyá múɔ njʉ̀njÿò nyɛ́ʼɛ lìi nŋwáʼ na ndùŋmvfò jʉʼ na mejʉʼ mɛ̌ sɔɔnmbʉ́a. N júʼ atsɔ̌ tàʼ na menɔ̀ɔn pa lekùɔ gɔɔn nò lé tsɔ̌ ngyè gie e gwáʼa ngyè lefaŋ sie é vɛ́te la ngie: «Tóo!»
en: Then I saw the Lamb open one of the seven   seals, and I heard one of the four living creatures say with a voice like thunder,  # 6:1 Rv 14:2; 19:6 “Come! ”

ngiemboon: N díe ńgyá, tàʼ fɔ́gɔ lÿóon kẅɛ, nyìŋ gẅie à néŋe mǒ, á gẅiin kyɛ́d. Mé náa cÿɔ̀ʼɔ lefùɔ mbwó yé. Á ne ńgee páʼ njÿò ncù, légʉa ńgíŋe ńjÿó ncù.
en: I looked, and there was a white horse.   Its rider held a bow;  # 6:2 Zch 9:13–14 a crown  # 6:2 Rv 14:14 was given to him, and he went out as a conqueror in order to conquer.  # 6:2 Or went out conquering and in order to conquer

ngiemboon: Múɔ Njʉ̀njÿò nyɛ́ʼɛ lìi nŋwáʼ na jʉʼ mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a, n júʼ nɔ̀ɔn mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a kwéʼe ngyè ye tÿǒ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Tóo!»
en: When he opened the second seal, I heard the second living creature say, “Come! ”

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tàʼ lÿóon gwóon ńkẅɛ, ḿbaŋ páʼ mmɔ̌g la. Mé ná metʉ̀ mbwó nyìŋ gẅie à la néŋe mǒ ngie à gʉa ḿmaʼa tág ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, ńzsé ngie pʉ̀a mesoŋ ge sele sɔbte mennɛ́ mɔ́b é kwéte, ńgÿo púʼu, ńnáa máamáa nně ncù né yé.
en: Then another horse went out, a fiery red one,   and its rider was allowed to take peace from the earth, so that people would slaughter one another. And a large sword was given to him.  # 6:4 Mt 10:34

ngiemboon: Múɔ Njʉ̀njÿò nyɛ́ʼɛ lìi nŋwáʼ na jʉʼ mbɔ́ɔntè yétá, n júʼ nɔ̀ɔn mbɔ́ɔntè yétá kwéʼe ngyè ye tÿǒ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Tóo!» N díe ńgyá tàʼ séssé lÿóon kẅɛ. Nyìŋ gẅie à néŋe mǒ gẅiin fʉ̀ʼncʉ̂e lɔg fʉ̀ʼʉ mmó mbwó yé.
en: When he opened the third seal, I heard the third living creature say, “Come! ” And I looked, and there was a black horse.   Its rider held a set of scales in his hand.  # 6:5 1Sm 2:3; Jb 6:2; 31:6; Ps 62:9; Pr 16:2

ngiemboon: N júʼ atsɔ́ mmó fó tsetsɛ̀ɛ menɔ̀ɔn lekùɔ ńkẅɛ, ńgwɔ́ páʼ ngyè nyìŋ la, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Gÿo na ntí gie mé ge lɔg nkáb fàʼ ye tàʼa lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ, é jú pɔ́ ndàʼ tàʼ kílò ngesáŋ ntsíŋ gie lezíŋ ée lê ɔ̂ɔjÿè, ńgwɔ́ gie e lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ngesáŋ yege, mé lɔg nkáb fàʼ ye tàʼa lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ, ńjúu kílò yétá, ńgʉa na mevɛ́ pɔ́ melùʼ, te gÿo na ntí gie mé ge zág.»
en: Then I heard something like a voice among the four living creatures say, “A quart of wheat for a denarius,   and three quarts of barley for a denarius,  # 6:6 2Kg 6:25; 7:1 but do not harm the oil and the wine.”  # 6:6 Rv 7:3; 9:4

ngiemboon: Múɔ Njʉ̀njÿò nyɛ́ʼɛ lìi nŋwáʼ na jʉʼ mbɔ́ɔntè lekùɔ, n júʼ nɔ̀ɔn mbɔ́ɔntè lekùɔ kwéʼe ngyè ye tÿǒ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Tóo!»
en: When he opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth living creature say, “Come! ”

ngiemboon: N díe ńgyá atsɔ̌ lÿóon kẅɛ, ńgʉme síŋ sǐŋ. Lezíŋ nyìŋ gẅie à néŋe mǒ gwɔ́ lê «legwé.» Ajʉʼ gie mepfó ée wó, á gwɔ́ nzèm yé. Mé gabte ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ nzsè lekùɔ, ńnáa tàʼ nzsè ngie pɔ́ sáʼ légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge lɔg nně ncù, é lɔgɔ gwáŋa, é lɔgɔ gwáʼa mbɔɔ menɔ̀ɔn tsẅɛ, é zẅéte pʉ̀a na yɛ̌ gwǒŋ.
en: And I looked, and there was a pale green   horse. Its rider was named Death, and Hades was following after him.  # 6:8 Hs 13:14; Rv 1:18; 20:13 They were  # 6:8 Other mss read He was given authority  # 6:8 Mt 10:1; 28:18; Rv 9:3 over a fourth of the earth, to kill by the sword, by famine, by plague, and by the wild animals of the earth.  # 6:8 Jr 14:12; 15:2–3; 24:10; 29:17–18; Ezk 5:12,17; 14:21; 29:5

ngiemboon: Múɔ Njʉ̀njÿò nyɛ́ʼɛ lìi nŋwáʼ na jʉʼ mbɔ́ɔntè yétʉ̂a, n gyá mentʉ́m pʉ̀a pie mé la zẅéte wɔ́b, mélàʼmie pɔ́ la shwóŋo nò Ssé mbɔɔ na páʼ pɔ́ la gɔɔn mmó gie pɔ́ zsé na nò Yěsô, é nuŋte tsìŋe jʉʼ gie mé nuŋe pwɔʼ wó,
en: When he opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of those who had been slaughtered because of the word of God and the testimony they had given.  ,# 6:9 Rv 1:2,9; 12:17; 19:10; 20:4

ngiemboon: ńne ńgaʼte lé ngyè tetʉ̂ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, gù gẅie ɔɔ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à shwóŋo nò nénʉ́, ɔ̀ ge zẅíʼte tà kú pɔ́ síŋe, tá ŋag pʉ̀a ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, é néŋ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ twó pɔ́b tí páʼ pɔ́ la zẅéte wég?»
en: They cried out with a loud voice, “Lord,   the one who is holy and true,  # 6:10 Rv 3:7 how long until you judge those who live on the earth and avenge our blood?  # 6:10 Dt 32:43; Ps 79:10; 119:84; Rv 19:2  ”

ngiemboon: Mé leen ńké ńnáa fɔ́gɔ zsǒ mbwó wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ na pɔ́b, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ náʼa ńgíŋ ḿbʉ́le ńzẅíʼte méjʉʼ, apfwɔ̀ʼɔ mefɛ̌ pɔ́b pie pâ pɔ̌ kɔ́ɔn ḿbú faʼa fàʼa Ssé, é tó tà ḿmag, á nue á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gíŋ ńzẅéte wɔ́b yɔ́b páʼ pɔ́b.
en: So they were each given a white robe, and they were told to rest a little while longer until the number would be completed of their fellow servants and their brothers and sisters, who were going to be killed just as they had been.

ngiemboon: Múɔ Njʉ̀njÿò ne ńnyɛ́ʼɛ lìi nŋwáʼ na jʉʼ mbɔ́ɔntè ntɔgɔ́, n ne ńdíe, ńjúʼ atsetsáʼ pú ńcʉʼʉ páʼɔɔn tɛʼ, nèm sele ésíŋ páʼ séssé lùŋo legwé la. Saŋ pú sele ḿbaŋ páʼ metse la.
en: Then I saw him open   the sixth seal. A violent earthquake occurred;  # 6:12 Rv 11:13; 16:18 the sun turned black like sackcloth  # 6:12 Is 13:10; 50:3; Jl 2:10; 3:15; Mt 24:29 made of hair; the entire moon  # 6:12 Or the full moon became like blood;  # 6:12 Jl 2:31; Ac 2:20

ngiemboon: Mecÿɔ́ʼsaŋ fó lefaŋ ńkeme ḿbʉle ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ páʼ máamáa fóm ne ńcʉa, mentɔ̌ɔn tÿǒ pÿɛ̀ mie é kaa tʉʉ, é keme ḿbʉle ssé púʼu la.
en: the stars   of heaven fell to the earth as a fig tree drops its unripe figs when shaken by a high wind;

ngiemboon: Lefaŋ mag páʼ tàʼ shʉa ffo ŋwàʼne gie mé ně ńkáte la. Mé fó na mejʉʼ mie mekwɛ́ ée wó, tà mbɔɔ na mejʉʼ mie meláʼ mie ntse la kéle ńnéŋe soŋ ée wó, ésaʼ ńdɔg ńgʉa.
en: the sky was split apart like a scroll being rolled up;   and every mountain and island was moved from its place.  # 6:14 Ezk 38:20; Nah 1:5; Rv 16:20

ngiemboon: Mefùɔ pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, memǎa pʉ̀a, metándá palÿɔ́ʼncù, megàŋ nkáb, megàŋ metʉ̀, menkwɔɔn tà mbɔɔ pandùnnɛ́. Pɔ́ metsèm lyeen tsɛ̀ɛ memvwɔ̀ʼ, á na memǎa metǒon mie ée ndùm mekwɛ́,
en: Then the kings of the earth, the nobles, the generals, the rich, the powerful, and every slave and free person hid in the caves and among the rocks of the mountains.

ngiemboon: ńne ńgɔɔn mbwó mekwɛ́, mbɔɔ mbwó memǎa metǒon ngie: «Pí keme sẅɛ́ɛ wég, ńdÿoon wég. Nyìŋ gẅie à néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ lɛ̂, á le gíŋ ńgyá wég wɔ́. Múɔ Njʉ̀njÿò le gíŋ ńgyáŋa lóŋ na peg wɔ́.
en: And they said to the mountains and to the rocks, “Fall on us and hide us   from the face of the one seated on the throne and from the wrath of the Lamb,

ngiemboon: Á nue máamáa lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ gie pɔ́ ge gyáŋa lóŋ aa páʼɔɔn, mbà à tǒ, ngwɔ́ wɔ̌ vwɔʼɔ?»
en: because the great day of their   wrath has come! And who is able to stand? ”  # 6:17 1Sm 6:20; Ezr 9:15; Ps 1:5; 24:3; 76:7; 130:3; Jl 2:11; Mal 3:2
